title: Royal Kerala
short_description: Colonial and traditional heritage stays amidst backwaters and coastal history.
long_description:
Kerala's royalty is subtle, defined by elegance, wood architecture, and a deep connection to nature. Unlike the stone fortresses of the north, Kerala's palaces are masterpieces of timber, tucked away in coconut groves or facing the backwaters.

The royal experience here is intimate. Properties like Chittoor Kottaram offer a 'single-key' experience, meaning you are the only guest in the Raja's palace. It is a journey into the life of the Cochrane and Travancore kingsâ€”quiet, understated, but profoundly luxurious. Expect private boat rides, barefoot luxury, and meals served on banana leaves with white-gloved service.

properties.title: Chittoor Kottaram
properties.short_description: A 300-year-old royal residence near Kochi accessible only by boat. You are the only guest.

how_to_reach: Accessible via boat from Kochi. Nearest airport is Cochin International Airport.
